fields.description:
hi,

As you know, Tempo is also a commonly used plugin. Like most Jira customers, we also use Tempo teams to set team structure on Jira projects. (a custom field named "Team" is used in projects and set from the list of organizational tempo teams) 

So when we assign an issue to a team (namely Tempo team) we don't have an option to send an email to team (active team members) using Automation for Jira. It would be great to have such a feature
fields.summary: ability to send email to Tempo groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [Automation for Jira - Server Lite|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211836/automation-for-jira-server-lite?hosting=server&tab=support] app is marked as compatible up to version 8.12.3 despite having version 8.13.1 released. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the compatibility of the app to the latest versions of Jira
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround as of now
fields.summary: Compatibility with current Jira version for Automation Lite

fields.description:
Currently, Automation for Jira can not detect users out of the office and prevent tickets from being assigned to them using the Balanced Workload component. 

It would be a nice feature, If a flag could be included on a user, that would prevent Automation for Jira rules from assigning tickets to the flagged user.
fields.summary: Introduce a way to remove users out of the office while assigning issues using the Balanced Workload method

fields.description:
As a rule writer

I want the ability to manage rules using folders

So I can easily write, test, and copy rules for my projects.

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * can create, update, and delete folders to store rules
 * folders containing enabled rules cannot be deleted without a warning acknowledgement
 * folders are named when created
 * folders can be renamed
 * folders can contain rules and other folders
 * folders (and their contents) can be exported
 * folders (and their contents) can be imported
 * folders (and their contents) can be copied to another project
 * bonus: folders can be drag-n-dropped into other folders
 * bonus: folders can be associated to a label

 

Business case:

Labels are a helpful way to organize automation rules. The addition of folders would reduce the need to use a large number of labels for organization of large rule libraries. Folders would also solve the problem that when there are a large number of rules, it is difficult to accurately assign them to a label (far up the screen) using drag-n-drop.

Further, folders would be an excellent way for Atlassian to distribute template rules for education and re-use by rule writers.  People could grab a folder of rules from an Atlassian documentation site (as JSON) and import it to speed up implementation and use.
fields.summary: add folders to organize rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After the release of the 7.2.2 version, there were changes in the way that Automation for Jira interacts with Insight's API. Whenever you try to search for objects, for each letter inserted, Automation for Jira is triggering requests, resulting in an excessive amount of them, causing performance issues for larger data sets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create rules with Insight components and performing searches for larger data sets.


h3. Expected Results

* Searches are triggered with an input delay that reduces the performance impact on the application.

h3. Actual Results

* Each letter triggers a number of requests causing performance issues.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searches for Insight Objects trigger requests for each letter inserted.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Watcher does not appear to be a triggerable field.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Trigger when watchers field changes

h3. Suggested Solution 
It should be doable for server through IssueWatcherAddedEvent.
fields.summary: A trigger for when a watcher is added/removed/updated to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you link a Jira issue to a URL or to a Confluence page, these links' information is stored on the *remotelink* table instead of the *issuelink* table. Because of that, the *Delete Issue Links* action, fails to remove them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira issue.
 # Click on the *More* button and select *Link*.
 # Click on *Web Link* at the sidebar.
 # Insert an URL and the *Link Text* that will be displayed in the issue created in step 1.
 # Configure a manually triggered rule with the *Delete Issue Links* action.
 # Access the issue created in step 1, and trigger the rule.

h3. Expected Results

* All issue links are removed.

h3. Actual Results
*  URL links and links to Confluence pages are not removed.

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-26 at 18.16.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "Delete Issue Links" action only removes links to other issues.

fields.description:
Dear all, 

It would make sense to have the possibility to sort or filter or group the rules created by manual trigger under More on Server. As when there more than 2 or 3 it will be difficullt to select them. 

Thank you in advance!

!image-2020-10-26-16-47-08-507.png!

Kind regards

Radosveta
fields.summary: Possibility to sort or filter or group the rules created by manual trigger under More on Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Observed incorrect comment retrieval of linked "duplicated by" issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import the attached automation rule. 
 # Enable it for the JSD project. 
 # Create two issues. 
 # Make sure to link issue A with Issue B as duplicated by issue. 
 # Perform transition in original issue and make sure the comments are updated in the duplicated issue. 
# The first comment will be as it is. However, from second comment onwards, comments are concatenated from latest to the oldest while updating in the duplicated issue. 

h3. Expected Results
- The comments should not be concatenated as we are retrieving only the last comment from the current issue. 

h3. Actual Results
-The first comment will be as it is. However, from second comment onwards, comments are concatenated from latest to the oldest while updating in the duplicated issue. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect retrieval of linked issue comments and comments authors

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In general: accessing the fields is only through advanced JSON

There are a number of fields that are attached to a list set through a gantt chart like UI i.e. Target start, Target due date etc. However, the above fields aren't actually attached to the issue, so probably require integration with Portfolio for Jira's API

h3. Expected Behaviour
It should be possible to select and edit Portfolio fields (like Team, Target Start, Target End ) in Automation for JIRA.

h3. Failures caused by this lack of support to Advanced Roadmaps'  fields.

While it is possible to use the *Edit Issue action*'s advanced section (i.e. the one available by clicking on the *More options* button), due to the lack of support to the *Target Start* and *Target End* fields, if you attempt to use any date functions (such as plusMonths, minusMinutes) the automation rule will fail due to a parsing failure.
fields.summary: Provide Support for Portfolio/Advanced Roadmaps for Jira fields (Team, Target Start, Target End)

fields.description:
An option to add smart value to include the name/email address of the recipients mentioned in the To, Cc, Bcc of Send email action of the Automation rule 

!image-2020-10-20-15-49-22-538.png|width=209,height=193!

something like {{{{to.displayName}}}} or relevant smart value.
fields.summary: Send email Content should include the option to use smart value for the email-recipient

fields.description: Currently, in Automation for Jira it is not possible for a project administrator to copy or share a rule with a different project administrator. As JSON exports/imports are restricted to users with the *Jira System Administrators* permission, project administrators are only able to copy rules from their own projects, or global rules.
fields.summary: Allow project administrators to exchange rules
Introduce an action to refresh user sessions.

fields.description:
Currently, we can only copy attachments using the "Edit Issue" action.

It might be good to be able of copying attachments that are inserted together with comments.

This could help specifically when Software issues are updated based on comments made on SD issue.
fields.summary: Allow users to copy attachments from comment
Using {{now.diff(duedate).days}} smart value inside of a list of issues doesn't present any results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, Automation for Jira does not provide any kind of support for epoch timestamp conversion, which can be essential to some use-cases.

It'd be great if that could be introduced into newer versions of the tool.
fields.summary: Add support to convert epoch timestamps to Jira dates

fields.description:
When customers select some of Insight (for example) fields in Automation for Jira because they want edit value of a field. For some reason there's no scope for those fields when I'm trying to find option that I want.

Another thing is that it only shows approximately 50 first results and there's no "Show more" button.

Could this be changed so that scope for fields from Insight (e.g) is selected based on what project I have chosen on Automation for Jira configuration? Like it works when I'm on some issue.

Also "Show more" button would be nice feature.
fields.summary: Allow customers to change the limit of field options that appear when searching for values

fields.description: When Automation for Jira makes changes to an issue, it should also record the name of the automation rule that performed the change. Currently it is difficult to trace which automation rule is responsible for the changes to an issue especially when there are many potential automations operating on the same issues.
fields.summary: Include name of automation rule in History log on issue

fields.description:
Hi there! 
U know about this situation, there is no ability to clone attachments to another project in Jira Automation, just only in Automation Service Desk. There is a link of this task [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1030] but nothing was changed a few years for Cloud, its so sad. Can you increase the importance of the task, since it makes the automation process quite difficult? Thanks a lot!
fields.summary: Attachments when cloning a task to another project
Ability to look up/lookup users

fields.description:
Customers want to be able of editing Issue Types using Automation for JIRA even though they have different workflows.

Currently, we have this message that shows up when users try to edit this issue field:

 !image-2020-10-05-11-07-39-524.png|thumbnail! 

It might be helpful if we could implement this.
fields.summary: Ability of editing Issue Types that use different workflows

fields.description:
For example, customer says:

{{{{triggerIssue.customfield_10700.summary}}}} is a smart value that retrieves an information from a field and delivers me already the information like this:
Text A, Text B, Text C
So in fact, that's already nice. I'm just missing a function to replace ", " by a line break to show finally on the description field:
Text A
Text B
Text C
fields.summary: Ability of replace characters on a text field using smart values

fields.description: It would be great if Jira Administrators could access the information related to the execution of their automation rules through other channels than the user interface, for instance, it would be helpful if the information was accessible via REST API.
fields.summary: Make the Audit Log information accessible via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using @mentions is currently not supported for use in triggering automation. This can be useful for:
 * Approvals
 * Triggering Slack Integration

Among many other options.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the use of @mentions to trigger automation.
fields.summary: Add @mentions to Event condition for automation.

fields.description:
STAGIL Assets (a third party application) has a feature called "Relation Custom Fields". 
 !image-2020-10-01-10-33-34-837.png|thumbnail! 

These relations are currently not recognized in Automation for Jira as a link type. It would be nice if Automation for Jira could recognize these link types in "Branch rule / related issues":
 !image-2020-10-01-10-34-18-280.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow for "STAGIL Assets - Advanced Links" type to be recognized as a link type in Automation for Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Before Jira Service Desk 8.11, changes performed by Automation for Jira to the *Customer Request Type* didn't generate a notification, even if the *This rule should send emails* option was checked. After Jira Service Desk 4.11, notifications are being sent even with that option *disabled*.

It seems that there was no event for that change earlier available so this wasn't built into A4J, but likely due to changes to the notification system performed in Jira SD 4.11, a new event was created and now A4J needs to suppress that event so the listener isn't triggered and a new notification sent for this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to change the request type change under certain conditions, such as an empty request type for issues created through Jira Create issue screen
 # Uncheck the option to send notifications

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 20.35.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

No notifications are sent regarding that change

h3. Actual Results

Notifications are sent to users added to the *Issue Updated* workflow event

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 20.34.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Customer request type changes are not being suppressed as of Jira 8.11

fields.description:
Currently, if you are using *Customer notifications* in Jira Service Desk and you are configuring such notifications, you have the ability to leave the *Exclude person who caused the action*.

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 05.57.14.png|thumbnail! 

If we check Automation for Jira's *Send e-mail* action, we can see that this option is not available:

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 05.58.47.png|thumbnail! 

It would be nice if this feature could be implemented in the future.
fields.summary: Implement the ability to exclude the person who caused the action in e-mails generated for Automation for Jira

fields.description:
When transferring Automation rules from one JIRA Service Desk instance to another, it is not possible to transfer rules pertaining to updating "Customer Request Type" rule to another JIRA instance
This suggestion request is to add the ability to modify 'Customer request type' by using a JSON value, rather than a rule configured via GUI
fields.summary: Ability to update "Customer Request Type" field using JSON in A4J rules

fields.description:
Whenever a rule needs multiple conditions to be evaluated inside a branch, if the first condition is not met, the rule will evaluate the other conditions.

Because of that, the rule below will fail to assign issues if the first condition is not met:

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-25 at 18.45.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results 

The first condition will fail and the automation rule will check the second.

h3. Actual results

The first condition will fail and the rule execution will end.

h3. Workaround

* Avoid using rules that use multiple conditions.
fields.summary: If-Else condition is not available inside branch components

fields.description:
For example: 
I would like to create a rule where a new Sub Task will be created if the first subtask of the ticket status is DONE.  (See attached file).
fields.summary: Condition to check on specific subtasks of an issue

fields.description:
Advanced Roadmaps (former Portfolio) extends issue hierarchies and uses the concept of Parent Link, which has a custom field associated with it.
 We should include support for this in Automation for Jira, such as the examples:
 * Branches to Parent/Child.
 * Setting/editing field actions.
 ** Including Copy value from.
 * Smart Values to access field values from related issues on the hierarchy.

This is a similar request to - [https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-1779]
fields.summary: Support "Parent Link" fields

fields.description:
I'm using Automation For Jira to GET from an external API. 

If this particular API responds with a 404, that tells me a resource does not (yet) exist, rather than something fatal having occurred.

Simply ceasing the automation workflow at the point a non-200 response is received is not always desirable. 

The ability to toggle whether the Web Request action stops or continues after a non-200 response would be most helpful here.

 

Cheers!
fields.summary: Send Web Request action should not deem all 40x responses as problematic

fields.description:
Currently, we are able to perform the manual trigger of an automation rule from an issue view.
In a Jira Service Desk Instnce, it would be nice to have the button also available in the Customer Portal view, to trigger the automation from the Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Ability to use Manual Trigger button on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
No smart value available that returns the filename of the latest attachment which has been added to an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Support for sorting this kind of collections based on time creation.
fields.summary: Smart value to get last added (in time) attachment
Allow project picker custom field to accept project name

fields.description:
h2. Summary

We want Jira Admins to be able to restrict the visibility of Global, Project and Multi-projects Automation Rules to specific groups or users — even excluding Project Admins who would otherwise have read-only access to them.
h2. Motivation

Some notification actions may have token/auth information that the Jira Admin doesn't want Project Admins to access.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Admins to restrict visibility of Automation Rules to groups or users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Existing issue labels are removed, when updating the rule to add a label. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a rule to add a new label (on top of existing labels - NOT replace)
2. Run the rule for the Labels field 
3. The existing Labels get erased and the new Label defined in Automation appears.

h3. Expected Results
Old labels stay and new labels get added defined in the automation rule.

h3. Actual Results
The existing Labels get erased and the new Label defined in Automation appears.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding label to the existing rule, erase the preexisting labels from the issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

No Trigger for Comment edited/deleted.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add to Automation for Jira a new trigger for Comment edit/deleted.
fields.summary: Trigger rule on comment edited/deleted

fields.description:
*Issue Description:*
 Error notification content is hard-corded and not customizable.

!1_GRfEDSOR8UFnCJl6IiIAfg.png|width=480,height=165!

For more feature details: [Better visibility of errors in Automation for JIRA|https://blog.codebarrel.io/better-visibility-of-errors-in-automation-for-jira-d74cfd7c8cee]

*Suggestion:*
 Use Velocity template or make it possible to edit from UI
 - [Jira Server - Customizing email content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/customizing-email-content-938847640.html]
fields.summary: Allow to customize fail notifications
Add support for 'Cascading select' fields in the simple form

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a rule with a *User Condition*, it's not possible to browse the user roles. No suggestions are provided, neither the drop-down menu shows any options.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the *Jira Administration Icon* > *Projects*, and select the correct project on the list.
 # You should be taken to the project settings page, click on *Project Automation* at the sidebar.
# Click on the *Create rule* button on the upper right corner of the screen.
# Select any trigger such as the *Manual trigger*.
# Click on *Add component*.
# Select *New condition*.
# Select *User condition*.
# Pick any value for the *User* field.
# Select *is in role* on the *Check to perform* field.
# Click on the *Criteria* field to select the role.

h3. Expected Results
* The roles are displayed and the project admin is able to select them.

h3. Actual Results
* The icon on the right side of the field keeps spinning.
* The roles are not displayed.

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-03 at 18.42.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: It's not possible to browse roles when using the "User Condition" component

fields.description:
{quote}As a rule writer

I want a user condition for non-issue entities

So I can detect actions by specific users.
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria (AC):
 * The user condition can be used with events that do not have issues, such as a Version Created or Sprint Started
 * The context of the user condition can be selected: trigger, issue, etc.

 

Business case:

There is currently no way to detect a user condition for non-issue entities.  The only work-around would be to artificially associate an issue as a link to the non-issue entity.  This work-around will not help in cases where no such issue exists, such as Version Created.
fields.summary: add user condition for non-issue entities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever an Automation Rule is configured using the *Field Value Changed* trigger and the *Attachments* field is selected. If a user replies to a message using an inline image, the inline imaged will be added as an attachment, but the rule will not be triggered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation Rule using the *Field Value Changed* trigger and select the *Attachments* field as the one that will be responsible for triggering it.
 # Create a Jira Service Desk request through the *Email requests* channel, using an e-mail (let's call it testmail@test.com) associated with a Service Desk customer.
 # Use an agent to add a comment to the request created.
 # A notification of the agent's comment will be sent to *testmail@test.com.
 # Using *testmail@test.com*, reply to the notification using an inline-image.

h3. Expected Results

The inline-image will be added to the request and the rule will be triggered.
h3. Actual Results

The inline-image is added to the request, but the rule is not triggered.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "Field Value Changed - Attachments" trigger fails when inline images inserted into Service Desk's notification replies are added as attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we use the "User Condition" option in "If/Else" condition, the condition cannot be saved if the criteria is left to the default "Empty/Unassigned". However, an assignee of an issue could be empty, so this is a valid use case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation for Jira 7.1.16.
# Create a rule to check User Condition.
# Check for Assignee is Empty.
 !image-2020-09-01-23-12-57-759.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to save the rule.

h3. Actual Results
Rule cannot be saved. Error message "Field can't be empty" is displayed.

h3. Workaround
Use "Issue fields condition" instead to check if a specific field is empty.
fields.summary: If/Else User Condition cannot be empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation rule to send emails does not send emails if condition contains a JQL check. No emails are sent, although audit logs show "Successfully sent email".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation for Jira 7.1.17
# Create a rule with the following:
#* Trigger - Issue Created
#* Condition - If Issue Matches JQL (issuetype = bug).
#* Action - Send email to an address.
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The email is sent.

h3. Actual Results
Automation audit logs show that email is successfully sent. But we do not see the emails in inbox. 

Problem happens on Automation 7.2.0 as well. When we create another rule, with same trigger, and same action, but without the condition, the emails get sent and appear on inbox.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation rule to send emails does not send emails if condition contains a JQL check

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently "Automation for Jira" does not provide an option to manually stop a rule which is running and in Status IN-PROGRESS.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be good to have an option to stop the rule manually.
fields.summary: Manual stop button for an Automation Rule

fields.description:
Customers want to be able to archive issues.

Currently we don't have an action that allows this. And it might need us to check if there are any available APIs to implement that.
fields.summary: Archive Issues

fields.description:
We have rules that when triggered clearly state in the audit log that they don't meet any of the matching conditions and therefore don't perform any actions return with the status of "Success" yet other rules will return the expected "No Actions Performed".

What is being asked is regardless of the type of condition being used if a rule performs no action on the issue then the status return should be "No Actions Performed".

Currently there is no documentation explaining when and why a rule will report success when no actions are performed.
fields.summary: Consistent use of "No Actions Performed" status to include all rules that don't perform any actions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you are configuring a rule, you can include the *Delete Issue Links* action. The component page informs you that you can provide an issue or issue type to unlink. However, you can only provide *issue link types* to be removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new automation rule.
 # Insert an action component.
 # Select the *Delete Issue Links* action.
 # Try to insert a value (such as an issue key) into the field.

h3. Expected Results
* Automation for Jira would accept the issue key and remove the issue links accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* User can not insert any values other than issue link types.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Delete Issue Links" action only allow users to provide issue link types.

fields.description: We need a way to not allow users with browser permissions on a project from executing a manual rule trigger.  It shows up under the more menu on an issue.  These users need browser permissions to view an issue but I have no way natively in automation for Jira that I can find that allows me to not allow these users from executing that rule trigger manually.  It's not good.
fields.summary: Permissions on Manual Triggers

fields.description: We would like the ability to Archive a Version in one project if a version matching via Regex is Archived in another project.
fields.summary: Trigger for Version Archived, Action to Archive a Version

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to :

- create/comment Confluence pages

- Add events to team calendars
fields.summary: Confluence integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The \{{version.releaseDate}} smart value does not properly set the release date of a newly created/released version to the value of the the triggered version. It appears to be empty when used within an action 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a rule that utilizes a version being released or created as a condition
 # The action should be for creating or releasing a new version
 # Enter \{{version.releaseDate}} in the release date field of the action

h3. Expected Results
The release date from the triggered version should be used in the actioned version

h3. Actual Results
The release date of the actioned version will be empty. If a log is added prior to the action, the release date value will be present but it still will not be used in the action

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: {{version.releaseDate}} smart value is empty when used in an action

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Automation gives an option to choose only the "Active Sprint" or the "Next Sprint" under Sprint Field of the "Edit issue" Action, nothing else.

h3. Expected Behaviour
The option should be able to choose any of the sprints from the backlog.

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available as of now.
fields.summary: Ability to choose any of the sprints from backlog
As an Automation for Jira user, I want to be able to access Atlassian Access user attributes

fields.description:
We should allow Component Leads to be used in:

   * Smart-values

   * User fields

   * Watchers

   * Outgoing emails

   * Assign
fields.summary: Allow component lead to be used in components configurations.

fields.description:
When using the trigger "Issue Updated" or "Field Value Changed" the rule will not be triggered for all custom fields. Specifically the custom fields of the [XRAY plugin|[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211769/xray-test-management-for-jira]] are not able to be used here.

How to replicate:
 * Setup Jira with A4J and XRAY
 * Create Project with enabled Xray TestManagement
 * Create Automation rule like with trigger *Issue Updated* or *Field Value Changed* (with i.e. Test Plan or other Xray Custom field to be monitored
 * enable the rule
 * Change any issue 

The rule(s) will only be executed on changes other than the XRay custom fields.

This has been tested with XRay 4.1.3 and A4J 7.1.17
fields.summary: Trigger "Issue Updated" and "Field value Changed" should also work for custom fields of plugins

fields.description:
It's great that JA allows teams to configure outgoing webhooks as an action, but it is very likely these outgoing calls will need authentication, stored as a header.

Customers would like to know these authorization headers are not stored in plaintext, but rather encrypted or hashed on their way to the database.

 

!Screen Shot 2020-08-20 at 8.42.05 AM.png|width=409,height=172!
fields.summary: Encrypt or Hash outgoing webhook headers

fields.description:
{quote}As an automation rule writer,

I want a glossary/dictionary of the available smart values

So that I am more effective at writing rules to solve my team's business needs.
{quote}
Acceptance Criteria:
 * One page containing all available smart values for automation for Jira
 * Consider using a wiki-format drill down (allowing rapid reading/scanning/searching, and then exploration of details).  For an example, please see your REST API documentation.
 * Each entry notes usage scope by product: Jira Cloud, Server/Data Center, JSD, etc.
 * Each entry notes version history for changes in behavior
 * Each entry lists/links to the child attributes (e.g. {{issue.resolution}} contains id, name, etc.
 * Add a link to this help within the automation rule editor
 * The documentation page shows the last updated date/time
 * Bonus: each entry contains example usage
 * Bonus: this page is dynamically updated by code releases, so it is always up to date
 * Bonus: when certain attributes are not available, work-arounds are suggested, such as calling the REST API using a web request to get at the data

Business Case:

 

If you regularly check community automation questions, you will find many are basic needs to learn the available smart values and their attributes. Although the REST API can reveal some of this information, it does not contain all of it.  Please consider developing a complete glossary/dictionary of the available smart values for each product in the Atlassian ecosystem, and make it automatically updated from the source code of releases of automation and the REST API.  Such a glossary/dictionary will save customers a large amount of time, and no doubt reduce the number of contacts to Atlassian support.

Thanks for your work to improve Jira!
fields.summary: Create a single smart value documentation glossary

fields.description:
{quote}As a automation rule writer
I want an action to call another rule
So I can reuse rule logic, reducing errors and maintenance costs
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Add a new trigger for a rule can only be called from another rule
 * Add an action to trigger another rule. This action cannot call the owning rule, reducing the chance of recursion.
 * The called rule can be optionally passed an issue key


Business value:
When logic is duplicated between rules, errors can occur when the rules get out of sync. This duplication can also lead to sprawling rules which are longer than necessary. The ability to reuse logic would prevent both of these issues.
fields.summary: Ability to call one rule from another

fields.description:
*Issue Description*

Currently, the Automation rule import wizard contains very limited options, which can make it very tedious/unpractical to import a JSON file containing a big number of rules.

*Suggestions*

Some improvements to the wizard that help sys-admins save time especially on large instances:
- An option to select all rules when importing
- An option to select all active rules when importing
- UI should differentiate rules that have the same name (maybe show the project context / rule ID)
- An option to import rules in its exported state (vs DISABLED by default)
- Option to overwrite rules (if the rule id, name and context matches) 
- Option to import rule owners (will need to add it to the export)
fields.summary: Improvements to the rule import wizard

fields.description:
{quote}As a project-administrator of automation rules

I want to enable/disable notifications at a rule-level

To reduce errors and the cost of managing rules
{quote}
 

Acceptance Criteria:
 * Notification emails can be enabled or disabled in the Rule Details
 * There is no action-level setting for enable/disable of notification emails
 * The default setting is enabled for rule-level notifications
 * Bonus: Remove the JSON indicator for the add-comment action which appears to indicate send notifications even though it does not send notifications to anyone.  This setting can only be seen when exporting the rule to JSON.
 * Double-bonus: Identify any other actions like add-comment which have an erroneous send notifications indicator, and remove them also.


Business Value:

Currently, automation rule actions such as Edit field each have an option to Send Notifications, which is enabled by default, and concealed under an expandable section of options.  When creating rules, or diagnosing noisy notifications, it is very cumbersome to search a large set of rules to find an offending notifying action.  The two ways to find these today are to: edit every single action in every rule to find the notifier, or to export the rules, one by one, to search for the notification tag set to True.

Moving this setting to a rule-level would greatly simplify enable/disable of rule notifications.
fields.summary: Move the option to suppress notifications to the rule-level

fields.description:
Basic building blocks for conditionals like an if block will allow users to add basic logic to their templates, e.g.

{{{{#if(issue.Labels.isEmpty)}}Labels is Empty!{{/}}}}
fields.summary: Add basic conditionals to smart values. (if, and, or, not)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
{code}{{issue.created.plusHours(issue.custom_text_field.multiply(2))}}{code} works in Cloud, but no server equivalent function available.

Summary of our findings:
 * The multiply() doesn't exist in server release and we use * for multiplication – [Maths|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/maths-993924866.html]
 * The following expression works for multiplying the value from a custom field :
{code:java}
{{#=}}{{issue.custom_text_field}} *2 {{/}}{code}
 * Date/Time functions mainly works with static value – [Date and Time functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/date-and-time-functions-993924864.html]
 * The following expression works for adding two hours to the issue creation date/time:
{code:java}
{{issue.created.plusHours(2)}}{code}
* However, we can't seem to combine both the functions together e.g: {code}{{issue.created.plusHours({{#=}}{{issue.custom_text_field}} *2{{/}})}}{code}:
 !rule.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new custom text field and associated to all relevant screens
 # Create new automation rule that multiply the number in custom text field and add to the issue created date/time
 # Create a new issue with some number value in custom text field
 # Check the issue created date/time

h3. Expected Results

Issue created date/time should be updated accordingly
h3. Actual Results

The date/time functions don't work with dynamic mathematical functions
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Date/time functions in automation rule don't work with dynamic mathematical functions

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have the ability to Rank issues based on some conditions like a custom field.
fields.summary: I'd like to have the ability to Rank issues based on some conditions
Delay in service desk SLA field values on issue creation

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, I'd like to have a smart value to disable notifications for a particular ticket.
 It could be something similar to Jira Service Desk where we have a flag _request.disable.notifications.url_ to turn off the notification.
fields.summary: I'd like to have a smart value to disable notifications for a particular ticket

fields.description:
Some customers would like to have a rule being triggered when a user is mentioned in a JIRA issue comment. 

That would be helpful for cases like sending automatic comments on the issue whenever this happens.
fields.summary: Trigger rule when user is mentioned on a comment

fields.description:
A nice editor for html emails.

Use something like: https://github.com/unlayer/react-email-editor
Or tinymce

Need to substitute in smart-values.


h4. Possible Workaround

As a workaround in the meantime, we do have customers who use html emails. The way they have done it is copy the html produced by Jira's emails and then substitute in the new values. Makes for hard to read configuration but it is possible.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor for emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue description

Workflow Transitions can be configured with a screen associated to them, so that when a user executes the transition, a screen is displayed to the user to set some fields during the transition.

When such transition is executed by the "Transition issue" action in an automation rule, the screen associated to this transition is not displayed to the user, which is the intended behavior by design.

h3. Suggestion

Improve the "transition issue" action so that it shows the screen to the user who triggered the automation.
fields.summary: Action "Transition issue" does not show the screen associated to the transition

fields.description:
It would be nice to have additional information about a rule's execution, centralizing this information into a new log file that would be saved to the filesystem, this approach would be highly beneficial.

Among the advantages of this approach, we can mention that the information would be centralized in a single place.
fields.summary: Improve logging by including more information on the Audit log and saving a log file in the Filesystem

fields.description:
The way rules are currently displayed is extemely tedious when working with longer rules.

Especially when checking or changing many components it gets really tedious to scroll down to the appropriate component, scroll all the way back up to actually see and change its configuration and then back down to the next component where the currently selected component is not even highlighted anymore which makes it even more difficult.

The list of the components should be decoupled from the actual "editing" part of the page and be separately scrollable.
fields.summary: Compact view of automation rule

fields.description:
It would be really helpful if the audit log was filterable/searchable, *especially by issue*.
Sometimes we need to look up if a automation rule has run correctly on a specific issue, with the current audit log it is near impossible to find the specific entries.

All the "no action performed" entries are also unhelpful and only clog the audit log.

The most obvious filters would be:
 * date

 * status

 * issue

*Workaround*
We can filter the audit log running a query in the database, as the query below searching for all rules executed for issue TST-123.
{code:SQL}
select AIAI."NAME", AI.* from jiradb.dbo."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM" AI
join jiradb.dbo."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_ASC_ITEM" AIAI on AI."ID" = AIAI."AUDIT_ITEM_ID" 
where AI."CATEGORY" = 'SUCCESS'
   and AIAI."NAME" = 'TST-123'
{code}
fields.summary: Make audit log filterable/searchable
Add richer Elements Connect (nFeed) integration to smart values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exported Automation rules from Cloud fails to be imported to Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export multiple rules from Cloud
 # Attempt to import them in Automation for Jira Server.

h3. Expected Results

The rules are imported without issues.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails and the following error is displayed:
 _"Error parsing provided JSON. Please ensure it was created using 'Export rules' previously. If the problem persists please contact Code Barrel support!"_

!image-2020-08-07-07-36-41-192.png|width=329,height=171!

The format of the export from Cloud rules export has changed slightly so that the fields in an issue condition is could look like:
{noformat}
"selectedField":
{ "type": "ID", "value": "issuetype" },
{noformat}
whereas they used to look like
{noformat}
"selectedField": "issuetype",{noformat}
This causes the import to fail.
 * Note that if the selectedField type is not ID, it should error out or at least ignore the field. 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exported Automation rules from Cloud fails to be imported to Server

fields.description:
At the moment, if we select the "Smart Value" option for "Assign Issue" action, the information in the field is matched towards {{user_key}} on the {{app_user}} table.

With the GDPR compliance efforts, user keys are now in the JIRAUSERXXXXX format. This makes it difficult to use "Smart Values" here.

Would be great if options can be allowed to match with  {{lower_user_name}} from the same table.
fields.summary: Have some flexibility in "Assign issue" actions.

fields.description:
Customers sometimes get the following:

"It was that the Summary field (required) was hidden and because that required field was not getting filled itwas giving us this error.

It would be really nice to have some user message appear to give us a better hint. It took a while to find what the problem was."
fields.summary: Message on fields that are hidden and must be fulfilled when creating or editing issues

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
Project administrators do not currently have a way to copy rules between projects and import from JSON definitions.

 

*Suggested Solution*
Allow JSON rule imports into a specific project by project administrators.

 

*Why this is important*
Offloads the effort to project administrators, and allows them to easily share rule definitions with other teams to increase collaboration.

 

*Workaround*
No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Allow project administrators to import rules via JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

If the default members of a Project Role exceed 50 users, the condition that checks if a user is part (or is not part) of this project role will throw the following message in the audit log, even if in reality the project role does not have more than 50 users:
{code}
The role has 50 or more users, only the first 50 users will be used
{code}

This message is misleading, since in reality the project role might have less than 50 users, and also the user condition might not work as expected, and check the actual users who are in the project role (instead of the users configured in the default members of this role).


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new Jira group, and add more than 50 users to it
# Create a new project role in *⚙ > System > Project roles*
# Click on *Manage Default Members* next to this role
# Add the Jira group as a default member of this role
# Go to a Project Configuration page, then go to "Users and roles"
# Only add 1 user to the project role created earlier
# Create a new automation rule in this project, including a User Condition configured as follows:
#- User -> "User who triggered the event"
#- Check to perform -> "is not in role"
#- Criteria -> add there the project role
# Trigger the automation rule
# Check the audit logs


h3. Expected results

The *User Condition* portion of the Audit log should only say:
{code}
The following issues passed:
<ISSUE_KEY>
{code}

h3. Actual results

The *User Condition* portion of the Audit Log says:
{code}
The following issues passed:
<ISSUE_KEY>
The role has 50 or more users, only the first 50 users will be used
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Go to the page *⚙ > System > Project roles*
# Click on *Manage Default Members* next to the project role used in the *User Condition* of the automation rule
# Remove the default members from this project role
fields.summary: User condition not properly checked when a project role has more than 50 default members

fields.description:
Hi,

I want to add users as watchers for a issue in an automation in JIRA Server.
It would be very helpful if you could implement that feature.

Regards
Fabian
fields.summary: Add user to issue watchers

fields.description:
So far, rules in [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/] could be created to run in three different scopes only:
 * All projects
 * Single project
 * Multiple projects

There should be another option in Scope for "All projects except few" so that users can restrict a rule to run for all projects except few like restricting only 3-4 projects for not running the rule.
fields.summary: To restrict Automation rules to run in "All projects except few"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portfolio uses the concept of Parent Link and has a customfield.

h3. Expected Results

Automation should work with Portfolio Link and support its hierarchy.

h3. Actual Results

Portfolio parent link isn't supported on 

 * Field value changed trigger
 * Setting/editing on field actions
 * Branch traversal
 * smart-values

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Support "Parent Link" fields

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have a database schema available similar to what we have for https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/attachments/jira-7-9-2-database-schema.pdf
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have a database schema available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently coping attachments from linked, parent or subtask issues duplicates attachments that have already been added every time it is executed, because it adds all the attachments in source to what already exists in target.

As a user, I'd like to avoid duplicates when copying attachment from linked issues using the Edit issue fields action.

h3. Suggested Solution
There are different ways we could implement this, but perhaps one suggestion is to:
* Provide the option to overwrite all the existing attachments in target with the attachments on the copy source issue.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to avoid duplicates when copying attachment from linked issues using the Edit issue fields action

fields.description: According to [here|https://blog.codebarrel.io/new-feature-user-transfer-with-automation-for-jira-88491b827c73], may possible to select transfer owner/actor on the config accrodingly?
fields.summary: Select transfer owner/actor on user transfer

fields.description: The new functionality of Smart values (Sum, average, max, min, aggregate) available natively in Jira Cloud (https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Automation-articles/New-automation-smart-values-in-Jira-Cloud/ba-p/1402775) would be so useful in Jira on-prem.
fields.summary: Add "Smart values" functionalities available in Jira Cloud to Jira Server

fields.description:
Currently, if your automation rules are comprised of components that use integration with other plugins, and you need to insert credentials for these rules to work, whenever you attempt to export/import these rules, the credentials information will be displayed as plain text, which could lead to security issues.

Because of that, there should be an cryptographic mechanism in place to prevent this information from being displayed.
fields.summary: Introduce a cryptographic mechanism to prevent the exposure of credentials while exporting/importing rules
Introduce smart values for transitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User in project role condition results in NullPointerException if actor is not an Admin user

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure automation rule as shown in the screenshot below:
 !image-2020-07-23-01-17-14-507.png|thumbnail! 
# Make sure the actor of the rule is not defined as a project administrator in the project's permissions

h3. Expected Results
Rule is either executed successfully or a helpful permission error is returned

h3. Actual Results
The exception below is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-01 20:22:09,873 http-nio-8802-exec-6 ERROR user123 1222x7195x1 1qbpjh 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/cb-automation/latest/project/10700/rule/35/execute/AUTO-23 [c.c.a.api.service.ComponentChainImpl] Unexpected runtime error executing component for config 'ComponentConfigBean{id='414', component=CONDITION, parentId='null', conditionParentId='null', schemaVersion=4, type='jira.user.condition', value=UserConditionConfig{conditions=[UserConditionCheck{field='reporter', check=NOT_IN_ROLE, criteria=[SimpleValue{type=NAME, value='Administrators', additional='null'}]}], operator=AND}, conditions=[], children=[], optimisedIds=[]}': 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.codebarrel.jira.role.NativeRoleClient.lambda$getUsers$1(NativeRoleClient.java:56)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.HashMap$KeySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1553)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:151)
	at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:174)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:418)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.role.NativeRoleClient.getUsers(NativeRoleClient.java:60)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.role.NativeRoleClient.getUserAccountIds(NativeRoleClient.java:67)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.user.UserCondition.lambda$getUsersInRoles$16(UserCondition.java:288)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1382)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.user.UserCondition.getUsersInRoles(UserCondition.java:295)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.user.UserCondition.checkUser(UserCondition.java:241)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.user.UserCondition.lambda$toUserCriteriaPredicate$3(UserCondition.java:151)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:174)
	at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1382)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.ConditionIssueMatcher.matchIssues(ConditionIssueMatcher.java:29)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.condition.user.UserCondition.executeWithIssues(UserCondition.java:82)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.api.component.executor.IssueRequiredExecutor.execute(IssueRequiredExecutor.java:34)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.api.component.executor.IssueRequiredExecutor.execute(IssueRequiredExecutor.java:17)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.api.service.ComponentChainImpl.doExecute(ComponentChainImpl.java:75)
	at com.codebarrel.automation.api.service.SingleRuleExecutorServiceImpl.execute(SingleRuleExecutorServiceImpl.java:224)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraAutomationExecutionService.runRule(JiraAutomationExecutionService.java:68)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraAutomationExecutionService.lambda$processEventWithRule$0(JiraAutomationExecutionService.java:45)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.lambda$executeAs$0(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:37)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.executeAsWithResult(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:67)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.executeAsWithResult(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:53)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.executeAs(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:36)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Ensure the user defined as the Actor is defined as a project administrator for the projects the automation is valid for
fields.summary: User in project role condition results in NullPointerException if Actor does not have project administration privileges

fields.description:
It would be great if we could branch within branches. 

For example, 'transition subtask based on another subtask transitioning'

This use case would be solved much easier with this feature.
fields.summary: Add support for nested branches (a branch within another branch)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there is a big number of label tagging in Automation of Jira, older label colours seems to get lighter.

In addition, the label is not visible except when hovering the mouse over.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation for Jira 7.1.16.
# Create 50+ labels.
# Tag some rules to some labels. Ensure that labels used to tag are the later created labels. In my example below, l1 is the first created label, l52 is the last created label.

h3. Expected Results
# Colour selected for tagging appears the same.
# Tagging is visible for the rule.

h3. Actual Results
# Colour selected for tagging gets lighter as more and more labels are created.
# Tagging is not visible for the rule.
!Automation_Label_Bug_1.PNG|thumbnail! 
 !Automation_Label_Bug_2.PNG|thumbnail! 
 !Automation_Label_Bug_3.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
No workaround yet.
fields.summary: Label tag colour not visible, when there are many labels (>50)

fields.description:
It would be useful to have the possibility to restrict which users are available for selection as the actor/owner of a rule.

A way to do that would be to restrict it by Project Roles or JIRA Groups.
fields.summary: Being able to restrict changing/selecting the Actor/Owner of a rule

fields.description: It would be good to have a trigger that listens to all "sprint start" event in JIRA not only listening to it by board configuration.
fields.summary: Global Start Sprint Trigger

fields.description:
At the moment, "Send Slack Message Action" is only available for the Pro version of Automation.

With Atlassian providing a free [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview], it would be great if we can have some Slack actions in Automation as well for free.
fields.summary: Include "Send Slack Message Action" in Automation Lite

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description:

Automation for Jira come out-of-the-box with built-in actions that are meant to send outbound Webhook to an external application, such as:
* Send Microsoft Teams message
* Send Slack Message
* Send web request

In case the connection to the external application (MS Team, Jenkins, Slack, etc...) is not successful, the rule fails and A4J does not try to send again the Webhook. As a result, in case of a slight network issue, the automation rule fails and is not executed again.

h3. Suggestion:

Change the way these rule actions work, so that they automatically try a 2nd time to send the Webhook to external applications in case of network issues.
fields.summary: Automatically try again to send an outbound webhook in case the 1st attempt failed due to connection failure

fields.description: It is possible to create a trigger for Issue events, although it currently only listens for [IssueEventBundle|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.6.1/com/atlassian/jira/event/issue/IssueEventBundle.html], and the suggestion is to also listen to [IssueEvent|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/writing-jira-event-listeners-with-the-atlassian-event-library/] as that is the one shared in the documentation and third party developers would expect that this would be the one Automation for Jira listens to.
fields.summary: Add the IssueEvent as part of the possible triggers

fields.description:
When configuring a simple rule in A4J  and specifying a JQL, it will be great to have the ability to tell AJ4 to run rules on issues one by one rather than in bulk.

A use case: 
1) Run a script is used as an action on a rule
2) The script uses external database table values to update JIRA issue custom field values on each issue one by one, rather than in bulk

Pseudo code of the logic is like this:

{code}
Start Automation Rule

Read Counter from Database/CMDB

For each Jira issue filter from JQL
// run the automation rule by each issue

Counter + 1

Set Custom Field A = Counter

End For Loop

End Automation Rule
{code}

While this seems to be a unique scenario applicable to a single customer only, having a flexibility like this in AJ4 will be great.
fields.summary: Ability to process a rule in sequential order rather than in bulk on JQL results

fields.description:
Currently, only a member of a role can restrict a comment to that role.

This can result in some oddities, like having an automation account being part of the Developers role, even though that account is generally an admin already.

The idea here is to give an option to bypass this check like there is in the "Transition Issue" action.
fields.summary: Create a bypass role restriction option for comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Restarting Jira loses/resets all labels in Automation lite. (v7.1.16)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Automation lite
# Go to Jira administration > system > Automation rules and add a label:  !image-2020-07-15-18-37-22-147.png|thumbnail! 
# Restart Jira
# Go back to Jira administration > system > Automation rule

h3. Expected Results
The labels created should remain.

h3. Actual Results
The labels disappear.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restarting Jira loses/resets all labels in Automation lite

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[How to use the Linked Issue Trigger in Automation for Jira|https://blog.codebarrel.io/how-to-use-the-linked-issue-trigger-in-automation-for-jira-1616b68c2d6e] describes how to use branch rule to setup a defensive rule that fires regardless of the direction of the link created. 

However, the rule won't work if its scope doesn't contain all the projects of issues that are being linked.

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify in the document that the branch rule has to either be global or have all the projects of issues that could potentially be linked to each other. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: [Documentation update] Clarify the impact of rule scope on branch rules
